definition: to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable

sentences.english: Pleasing to the ear listen, basic it is routine is directed in remote control.
sentences.chinese: 順耳一聽，基本都是在遙控指揮日常工作。

sentences.english: How natural is the sound from your hearing aids?
sentences.chinese: 你的助聽器所接收的聲音順耳自然嗎？

sentences.english: You shouldn't just listen to what pleases you.
The offer was complimentary. Also, it had its temptations.
sentences.chinese: 這個提議聽來很是順耳，且又不無誘惑。

sentences.english: Well, that does sound a little weird, but try the steak.
sentences.chinese: 行，這東西聽着不順耳，那就去嚐嚐牛排吧。

sentences.english: Love addict sounds nicer for sure.
sentences.chinese: 當然，愛上癮聽上去更順耳。

definition: nonsyllabic final r 儿 added to a word in spoken Chinese/also called retroflex final or r-ization
lit. to hate iron for not becoming steel/to feel resentful towards sb for failing to meet expectations and impatient to see improvement (idiom)
to act stupid/to play dumb/to pretend to not know
to make a fool of oneself
to view one's past as miserable and one's present as happy (idiom)
to get straight to the point (idiom)
overtones in conversation/things indirectly implied from what is said
to make fun of/to seek diversion
